titleStmt.title: The history of the late English rebellion, deduced from its first flame in 1640. And continued to the quenching thereof by His Majesties happy restauration [sic], 1660. / By W. Y. To which is added Fundamentum patriæ or, Englands settlement being a view of the state affairs in this kingdom, since His Majesties restauration, to the year, 1665.
titleStmt.author: Younger, William, 1605-1662.

titleStmt.title: The history of the late English rebellion, deduced from its first flame in 1640. And continued to the quenching thereof by His Majesties happy restauration [sic], 1660. / By W. Y. To which is added Fundamentum patriæ or, Englands settlement being a view of the state affairs in this kingdom, since His Majesties restauration, to the year, 1665.
titleStmt.author: Younger, William, 1605-1662.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed for Tho. Rooks, at the Lamb and Ink-bottle at the East-end of S. Pauls, who makes the best ink for records,

notesStmt.note: "Fundamentum patriæ: or, England's settlement", published anonymously, has its own titlepage, signatures and pagination.
Imperfect: stained and tightly bound with slight loss of text.
Reproduction of the original in the National Library of Scotland.
